lexUnit.name: compassionate.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing concern for the suffering of others

sentence.text: They would also like the old democracies to look upon their young ones with a more compassionate eye .
The store manager did indeed say he was a fairly hard-line manager looking for efficiency , whereas the personnel manager took a more compassionate stance .
If we ascribe this to the archetype of the Great Mother , then it seems that her presence at the time of death reveals one of her most compassionate aspects .
For the Profitboss it is the most compassionate way of easing out Hugh Clarkson , the dyed-in-the-wool western region sales manager who 's had enough but ca n't afford to admit it .
Those of us who now recognise it as immoral do so , not because we are compassionate , but because we recognise the equal rights of humans and the duties that follow from recognising those rights .
Reaching out , she touched him , a compassionate look in her eyes .
Andrew 's compassionate brown eyes registered shock , and then regret .
Colleagues described Dorrance as a gentlemanly , compassionate man with a lot of moral commitment .
He was a compassionate man , Dad , but never at the expense of drawing attention to his own opinions .
The centurion is also shown to be a compassionate man , for he cares about the health of one of his servants .
` Is it compassionate for a person to be kept alive with tubes going into their stomach ?
May we use his example to remind us to be caring and compassionate to everyone this Christmas time .
Be kind and compassionate to one another , forgiving each other , just as in Christ God forgave you .
Balboa was constructive in his approach to the Isthmus , generally compassionate to the Indians , inventive in his plans for exploration and the furthering of Imperial aims .
Officers will do their best to be compassionate towards parents , for example referring to the dead child by his/her first name and whenever possible a female officer will attend .
The mental picture of three compassionate children seemed very attractive .
` You look older , my friend , " Surkov said , fixing me with a compassionate gaze .
He inspired a genuine affection in both his pupils and staff , and many a young tearaway returned to the straight and narrow as the result of his firm but compassionate influence .
Another time , noticing the pain of a cow in labour and a small girl who shed compassionate tears as she watched , he thought the scene ` pure , wonderful , beautiful " .
Will you help us to support their compassionate work ?
Just a compassionate girl working amongst dirt and poverty .
The difference was that he accepted her attempt at consolation , taking her palm between both of his own hands , holding it gently and meeting her compassionate gaze with the glimmer of a smile .
In American Without Tears , he even sounded compassionate , for once .
The brown , smoky eyes were not especially compassionate ; merely lucid .
This time her eyes were troubled , compassionate .
Her motive was only partly compassionate .
As he held her eyes for a moment a look passed between them , deeply compassionate , oddly intimate .
Caroline tried to sound compassionate .
Mackerras 's account was compassionate but redblooded , direct but full of charm .
Right from the outset I was struck by Sr. Susan 's outgoing , down-to-earth , compassionate and cheerful approach to life : she is certainly a Faithful Companion of Jesus .
What displaced it was a sense of outrage that a man as kindly and compassionate as Edwin Frere should find himself shackled to a vixen .
